abstract.p: FT.com in London, Internet partner of The Financial Times, expands its relationship with New York office of BBDO Worldwide by naming agency to lead new integrated marketing program in US; estimated spending is $15 million (Advertising column) (S)

block.p: FT.com in London, the Internet partner of The Financial Times, has expanded its relationship with the New York office of BBDO Worldwide, part of the Omnicom Group, by naming the agency to lead a new integrated marketing program in the United States, which includes public relations, online advertising and direct marketing. Spending for the assignment was estimated at $15 million.

FT.com in London, the Internet partner of The Financial Times, has expanded its relationship with the New York office of BBDO Worldwide, part of the Omnicom Group, by naming the agency to lead a new integrated marketing program in the United States, which includes public relations, online advertising and direct marketing. Spending for the assignment was estimated at $15 million.

BBDO New York will handle strategic duties and coordinate the account with shops like @tmosphere in New York; Direct Partners in Marina del Rey, Calif., and New York; and Porter Novelli in New York. Spending for the advertising assignments that BBDO New York already handles for FT.com were estimated at $35 million. FT.com and The Financial Times are part of the Financial Times Group unit of Pearson.
